page.title: 06KILMINGTON CONT'D
page.content: Many of the older buildings are constructed of local stone. There are also brick-built and rendered houses and bungalows. The materials used for the roofs are tiles (91), slate (51), thatch (9), corrugated metal (2), asbestos (1) and timber (1). { {THE PEOPLE.} There are 353 people living in the dwellings we surveyed, so that is approximately half the population. 266 of these are adults, 80 of whom are in full-time employment, 15 are currently unemployed and 102 are retired. Presumably the remaining 69 are housewives and mothers. 54 of the adults told us that they had attended Kilmington Primary School as children. 48 of the people interviewed said that they have relatives living in the village now.
